title.narrative: Youth Development through TVET & Technology Program

description.narrative:
Objective 1: Enable existing TVETs to provide quality demand-driven educational services to youth to match needs of local labor market. A. Conduct an assessment of current TVET institutions, and identification of private sector partners at program start-up phase.
B. Improve the quality of vocational training courses offered by TVET Institutions by offering internationally recognized training courses and certifications at established Cisco Certified Training Academies and Microsoft Certified IT Training Academies.
C. Improve the business and life skills of TVET students by integrating Entrepreneur and Business Skills Course “Intel Learn: Technology and Entrepreneurship” within the TVET institutions’ curriculum
D. Enhance the ICT training capacity of TVET institutions to provide students with market driven skills and enhance training delivery, mobility and effectiveness
Objective 2: Increase access of youth to employment opportunities in the local labor market and enhance TVET institutions’ youth outreach capacity through effective use of technology and ICT
A. Engage youth through technology and social media to increase awareness, and cultivate better prepared youth for the workplace through employability skills and apprenticeships / internships.
B. Utilize IT to make TVET services/programs more relevant and useful for the needs of Palestinian youth today.

The proposed program will increase appropriate employment and self-employment opportunities for youth in the West Bank by ensuring access to quality TVET institutions and utilizing relevant technology and ICT-based interventions. Mercy Corps will work with existing TVET institutions to ensure market-based courses and curricula, quality instruction and teaching methodologies, necessary infrastructure support, as well as links to local labor market opportunities post-graduation. Building on Mercy Corps’ experience in the region, the program will have a unique focus on the use of technology in the classroom and in the workforce and will also equip youth with relevant skills needed for labor participation in the ICT sector. Through a youth-led, market-driven approach, the program will promote youth development in the West Bank through the provision of transferable and technical skills and accessible, quality educational and employment opportunities rooted in local labor market demand. The program will also make an important contribution to strengthening and diversifying the skills of the rapidly growing Palestinian workforce.
